intro: Trigonella mniocarpa, commonly known as the narrow-fruit fenugreek, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod-like fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptability to harsh conditions. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by slender, three-angled pods that contain several seeds. The species is of interest in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and potential ecological roles.
